column4: ok so I have this app that is likely to take down the whole system
short of running a whole linux system in a VM, is there a safety wrapper I can put around this app to sandbox it?
app is amsn
it depends on what you're trying to prevent from happening
I am trying to stop it freezing the whole system and bringing about a catastrophe that could endanger the lives of everyone
there's very little defense against poorly written software.
we are all doomed
Have you seen what most of the world are running?
what's amsn? Are you looking for an IM app?
I am looking for an alternative yes, but I have some messages in amsn, and I want to check them
but, this version has a unique 'kill the system when you open lol' feature

I'm not familiar with amsn, but if I were you I'd try to fix the problem that crashes the system. If amsn is a gui app, you might be able to get more feedback (in the way of error messages) by running it from a terminal. Just a shot in the dark :)
I have another question, from TTY1 (right term?) can I open a GUI app to show in alt-f7 (what is the right term?)
because, the gui on the terminal might freeze, and I can't ctrl-c the app
you can open a terminal in your desktop environment, rather than switching out to a virtual terminal
then you'd have the app and the launching terminal both on the same screen
I won't be able to alt-tab / click on it, because the system freezes, but alt-f1 term works
I've kills amsn (wish8.5) and gnome-* and other apps, but system is still frozen when it happens
ctrl+alt+backspace will restart your gui when that happens. I'd just be worried about finding the error messages and trying to fix them. Does your app put any logs in /var/log?
I'll rerun it with ctrl-alt-backspace in mind, thanks
np, good luck
